Hypersonic SQL is a small, open source, pure Java, database with the
possibility of setting up a database in memory.

http://hsqldb.sourceforge.net/

I would strongly recomend Hypersonic SQL for unit tests instead of writing a
new one.  Last time I looked, it did not support views, but it should be
easier to add missing functionality to Hypersonic SQL than to create a new
one.

Lutris InstantDB was once planned as an open source product, but it seems
from Lutris's site that those plans have been scrapped.

Regards,

Magnus

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Heath, Joseph [mailto:HeathJ@...]

> I guess what we really need here is a small ,
> in memory database that can be run as part of a
> test case. That is, the setUp() starts the the
> DB itself.
>
> Anyone know of such a thing? or want to write one?
>
